types.name: BitcoinAccount
types.description: The btcoin account object implements the Account interface for Bitcoin chain.

types.name: BitcoinBlock
types.description: The bitcoin block object implements Block interface for Bitcoin chain.

types.name: BitcoinTransaction
types.description: The BitcoinTransaction objects implements Transaction interface for Bitcoin chain.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a date and time in the UTC
timezone. The DateTime appears in a JSON response as an ISO8601 formatted
string, including UTC timezone ("Z"). The parsed date and time string will
be converted to UTC and any UTC offset other than 0 will be rejected.

types.name: Float
types.description:
The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional
values as specified by
[IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description:
The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.
Int can represent values between `-(2^53 - 1)` and `2^53 - 1` since it is
represented in JSON as double-precision floating point numbers specified
by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: OCAP adopts cursor-based pagination model. A cursor is a string value and serves like an anchor between two queries. The cursors are opaque which means their format should not be relied upon. We encode cursors in base64.

types.name: PageInput
types.description: The common arguments for quering data with pagination.

types.name: PageOrder
types.description: When you carry out a query, in most of cases you can provide which field you want to us to order the result. The field to be ordered is vary query by query.

types.name: PagedBitcoinAccounts
types.description: Represents paginated bitcoin accounts.

types.name: PagedBitcoinBlocks
types.description: Represents paginated bitcoin blocks.

types.name: PagedBitcoinTransactions
types.description: Represents paginated BitcoinTransactions.

types.name: PagedTransactionInputs
types.description: Represents paginated TransactionInputs.

types.name: PagedTransactionOutputs
types.description: Represents paginated TransactionOutputs.

args.name: address
args.description: The address generated based on the public key of the account.

fields.name: blockByHash
fields.description: Returns a block by it's hash.

args.name: hash
args.description: The hash of the block.

fields.name: blockByHeight
fields.description: Returns a block by it's height.

args.name: height
args.description: The number of blocks ahead of this block.

fields.name: blocksByHeight
fields.description: Returns blockks with paginations based on their height.

args.name: fromHeight
args.description: The height of block from which to return.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

args.name: toHeight
args.description: The height of block to which to return.

fields.name: emptyBlocks
fields.description: Returns blocks containing only coinbase transaction.

args.name: fromHeight
args.description: The height of block from which to return.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

args.name: toHeight
args.description: The height of block to which to return.

fields.name: richestAccounts
fields.description: Returns richest accounts, order by balance.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

fields.name: transactionByHash
fields.description: Returns a transaction by it's hash.

args.name: hash
args.description: The hash of the transaction to return.

fields.name: transactionByIndex
fields.description: Returns a transaction within a block by given the block hash or height and the transaction's index.

args.name: blockHash
args.description: The hash of the block containing the target transaction.

args.name: blockHeight
args.description: The height of the block containing the target transaction.

args.name: index
args.description: The index of the transaction insdie the block.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

args.name: receiver
args.description: Specifies the receiver's address.

args.name: sender
args.description: Specifies the sender's address.

fields.name: transactionsByIndex
fields.description: Returns transactions within a block by given the block hash or height and the range of the transaction index.

args.name: blockHash
args.description: The hash of the block containing the target transactions.

args.name: blockHeight
args.description: The height of the block containing the target transactions.

args.name: fromIndex
args.description: The index of the transaction from which to return.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

args.name: toIndex
args.description: The index of the transaction to which to return.

fields.name: zeroFeesBlocks
fields.description: Returns blocks having no fees collected.

args.name: fromHeight
args.description: The height of block from which to return.

args.name: paging
args.description: Describes which page of data to return.

args.name: toHeight
args.description: The height of block to which to return.

types.name: String
types.description:
The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8
character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to
represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: bigTransactionExecuted
fields.description: return transaction data once a big transaction happened. The threshold is 100 bitcoin.

fields.name: coinReceived
fields.description: return transaction once an address received bitcoin.

fields.name: coinSent
fields.description: return transaction once an address sent bitcoin.

fields.name: newBlockMined
fields.description: return block data once a new block is mined

types.name: TransactionInput
types.description: The TransactionInput object represents the transaction inputs in a Bitcoin transaction.

types.name: TransactionOutput
types.description: The TransactionInput object represents the transaction outputs in a Bitcoin transaction.

types.name: __Type
types.description: Represents scalars, interfaces, object types, unions, enums in the system

types.name: __Schema
types.description: Represents a schema

types.name: __Directive

fields.name: onField
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FIELD

fields.name: onFragment
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value FRAGMENT_SPREAD

fields.name: onOperation
fields.deprecationReason: Check `locations` field for enum value OPERATION

types.description: Represents a directive

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true."

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
